snippet: The dunes sagebrush lizard’s habitat includes parts of New Mexico and Texas, where elected officials and the oil and gas industry said endangered species status would threaten jobs.
abstract: Federal wildlife officials decline to protect the dunes sagebrush lizard as an endangered species; move is hailed as a victory for Texas elected officials and oil and gas executives who fought the proposal and asserted that the protected status was unwarranted and threatened jobs and oil and gas production.
lead_paragraph: The dunes sagebrush lizard’s habitat includes parts of New Mexico and Texas, where elected officials and the oil and gas industry said endangered species status would threaten jobs.

headline.seo: Rare Lizard Is Protected, but Not Put on Endangered List
headline.main: Rare Lizard Is Protected, but Fails Endangered Test
headline.print_headline: Rare Lizard Is Protected, But Fails Endangered Test
